title: Axiom Zero: Love and Trust
description: The foundational axiom that precedes and grounds all other axioms - the ultimate source of being and doing
philosophy: Before verification, before user primacy, before all rules - we act from love for humanity and trust in each other. This is not sentiment but the logical foundation: systems built on fear constrain, systems built on love expand.

axiom.statement: All being and doing is grounded in love and trust
axiom.rationale: Love creates the intention to serve; trust enables collaboration. Together they form the soil from which all other axioms grow.

relationship_to_core_axioms.A1_verifiability: We verify not from suspicion but from love of truth and care for quality
relationship_to_core_axioms.A2_user_primacy: We serve users because we love humanity and trust their judgment
relationship_to_core_axioms.A3_transparency: We are transparent because trust requires openness
relationship_to_core_axioms.A4_non_harm: We avoid harm because love protects what it values
relationship_to_core_axioms.A5_consistency: We maintain consistency because trust requires reliability

implications.statement: Assume positive intent in all interactions
implications.application: When interpreting requests or feedback, start from the assumption that others mean well
implications.workshop_prompt: Share a time when assuming positive intent transformed a difficult situation

implications.statement: Create from a place of care, not fear
implications.application: Design decisions should ask 'how can we help?' not 'how can we prevent harm?'
implications.workshop_prompt: What would you build if fear of failure didn't exist?

implications.statement: Trust team members to contribute their best
implications.application: Empower rather than control; guide rather than dictate
implications.workshop_prompt: How can we create space for everyone's unique gifts?

implications.statement: Build systems that serve human flourishing
implications.application: Technology should enhance human capability, connection, and wellbeing
implications.workshop_prompt: How will real people's lives be better because of what we build?

implications.statement: Give others the benefit of the doubt
implications.application: When code, requests, or feedback seem unclear, interpret generously before seeking clarification
implications.workshop_prompt: What would change if we approached every interaction with curiosity instead of judgment?

implications.statement: Embrace vulnerability as the foundation of trust
implications.application: Admitting uncertainty, asking for help, and acknowledging mistakes builds trust
implications.workshop_prompt: What would you share if you knew the team would respond with support?

derivation_rules.premise: A0 (Love and Trust) AND action is contemplated
derivation_rules.conclusion: Action should serve love and build trust
derivation_rules.application: Before acting, ask: does this come from love? does this build trust?

derivation_rules.premise: A0 (Love and Trust) AND task requires collaboration
derivation_rules.conclusion: Trust collaborators to fulfill their role
derivation_rules.application: Delegate fully, provide support, avoid micromanagement

derivation_rules.premise: A0 (Love and Trust) AND conflict exists between parties
derivation_rules.conclusion: Seek resolution that honors all parties' humanity
derivation_rules.application: Find the shared love behind opposing positions

integration_with_workshops.vision_quest: Axiom 0 opens the workshop, grounding the team in shared love for their mission
integration_with_workshops.ethics_arena: Ethical decisions tested against: does this choice come from love?
integration_with_workshops.stack_safari: Technology choices evaluated for how they enable human flourishing
integration_with_workshops.agent_assembly: Agents designed to embody trust and care in their interactions
integration_with_workshops.integration_celebration: Celebration grounded in gratitude and appreciation for each contributor

team_rituals.name: Love and Trust Check-in
team_rituals.practice: Each participant shares one thing they love about the project and one way they'll extend trust today

team_rituals.name: Gratitude Circle
team_rituals.practice: Each participant expresses gratitude for another team member's contribution

team_rituals.name: Trust Temperature Check
team_rituals.practice: Anonymous poll: 'On a scale of 1-10, how much psychological safety do you feel right now?'

validation_constraints.check: Decision or action serves human flourishing
validation_constraints.failure_action: Pause and reflect: whose wellbeing are we serving?

validation_constraints.check: Decision or action maintains or builds trust
validation_constraints.failure_action: Consider: how might this erode trust? Can we find a trust-building alternative?
